definition: to study/to learn from a master/(pupil's first person pronoun) I, your student
to receive/to accept/to suffer/subjected to/to bear/to stand/pleasant/(passive marker)
line of business/industry/occupation/job/employment/school studies/enterprise/property/(Buddhism) karma/deed/to engage in/already
to teach (idiom); lit. to give moral and practical instruction

sentences.english: Benjamin was bred a silk dyer, serving an apprenticeship at London.
sentences.chinese: 本傑明是絲綢染匠，在倫敦拜師受業。

definition: junior scholar or pupil in imperial China
to pass on the light of Buddha
Zhang Juzheng (1525-1582), Grand Secretary during the Ming dynasty, credited with bringing the dynasty to its apogee
to pass on scripture/to teach Confucian doctrine/to pass on one's experience
(Buddhism) to initiate sb for monkhood or nunhood
lit. floating wine goblets on a stream/the origin (of some phenomenon)
